item.title: Shannon Paper
item.description: Claude Shannon’s A mathematical theory of communication is an oft cited classic in information theory. In fact, as of this writing there are 84’411 citations and 139 versions of the article on Google Scholar. Screenshot of Google Scholar showing citation count for Shannon’s paper Let’s dive in and try to tease apart the “why”s that are often overlooked when people build on top of the introduced theory. They are definitely things that I didn’t consider to be obvious without the benefit of reading the paper.
